gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: GT11 - Fe Soluble from the U.S. GEOTRACES NAT project of the U.S. GEOTRACES program

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: Soluble Fe passed through 0.2 um Anopore filter, from GT11 cruise. Dataset Description: <p>Soluble iron (Fe), the Fe passing through a 0.02 µm Anodisc membrane filter, is reported in nmol Fe per kg of seawater. Samples were collected on the U.S. GEOTRACES North Atlantic Zonal Transect, Leg 2, in 2011.</p><p>In comparing this data to other published profiles of soluble Fe, it is valuable to know that soluble Fe is a highly operationally-defined parameter. The two most common methods of collecting soluble Fe samples are via 0.02 µm Anopore membrane filtration (this study) and by cross-flow filtration. An intercalibration between the two methods used to collect soluble Fe samples on the U.S. Atlantic GEOTRACES cruises are described in <a href="http://bcodata.whoi.edu/US_GEOTRACES/AtlanticSection/Boyle/Excerpt_from_Fitzsimmons_manuscript.pdf" target="_blank">this excerpt (PDF)</a> from a Fitzsimmons manuscript (in preparation). The intercalibration determined that "<em>soluble Fe produced by cross-flow filtration (10 kDa membrane) is only ~65-70% of the soluble Fe produced by Anopore filtration</em>."</p><p>Please note that some US GEOTRACES data may not be final, pending intercalibration results and further analysis. If you are interested in following changes to US GEOTRACES NAT data, there is an RSS feed available via the BCO-DMO <a href="http://www.bco-dmo.org/project/2066">US GEOTRACES project page</a> (scroll down and expand the "Datasets" section).</p> Acquisition Description: <p>Trace metal-clean seawater samples were collected using the U.S. GEOTRACES sampling system consisting of 24 Teflon-coated GO-FLO bottles that had been pre-rinsed with a 24+ hour treatment of filtered surface seawater at the beginning of the cruise (see Cutter &amp; Bruland, 2012 for more information on the sampling system). At each station, the bottles were deployed open and tripped on ascent at 3 m/min. On deck, the bottles were kept in a trace metal clean sampling van over-pressurized with HEPA-filtered air, except immediately prior to and following deployments, in which cases they were covered on both ends with shower caps to avoid deck contamination.</p><p>During sampling in the clean van, the GO-FLO bottles were pressurized to ~0.4 atm with HEPA-filtered air, and their spigots were fitted with an acid-cleaned piece of Bev-a-Line tubing that fed into an Acropak-200 Supor capsule filter (0.2 µm pore size made of polyethersulfone). Before use, this filter had been filled with filtered surface seawater that had been acidifed to pH 2 with 4x Vycor-distilled hydrochloric acid ('trace metal clean HCl') and left overnight to rinse. Before collecting any subsamples, at least 500mL of seawater was passed through the filter (while eliminating air bubbles in the capsule reservoir). Subsamples were taken into acid-cleaned HDPE bottles after a single rinse. Acropak filters were used for at most 3 casts before a new filter was used, and they were stored empty in the refrigerator while not in use. GEOFish surface samples were taken using an all-plastic 'towed fish' pumping system as described in Bruland et al. 2005 at approximately 2 m depth and were subsampled identically.</p><p>Subsamples were immediately taken into a HEPA-filtered flow bench constructed in a 'plastic bubble' over-pressurized with HEPA-filtered air. They were then further filtered through an offline filter rig fitted with a 0.02 µm pore-sized alumina Anodisc filter (47mm) and pressurized to ~0.4atm. Un-rinsed filters were loaded straight into the filter rig and were first rinsed with &gt;50mL of pH 2 trace metal clean HCl, and then they were rinsed with &gt;50mL of Milli-Q water. Before each sample was processed, &gt;50mL of sample was passed through the filter. Subsamples were taken into acid cleaned HDPE bottles after a single bottle rinse. Filters were shared for at maximum 2 sampling depths to avoid filter clogging. All samples were filtered within 3-6 hours of being collected to avoid Fe loss to the bottle walls (Fitzsimmons &amp; Boyle, 2012), and samples were acidified at sea to pH 2 with trace metal clean HCl.</p><p>Samples were analyzed at least 5 months after acidification over 18 analytical sessions by the isotope-dilution ICP-MS methods described in Lee et al. 2011, which includes pre-concentration on nitrilotriacetate (NTA) resin and analysis on a Micromass IsoProbe MC-ICP-MS. On each day of sample analyses, procedure blanks were determined using 12 replicates of 300 µL of an in-house standard reference material seawater (SAFe surface underway), where the known amount of Fe in the 300 µL was subtracted out. The procedure blank over the relevant sessions ranged from 0.006-0.108 nmol/kg, averaging 0.051 nmol/kg. Procedure blanks were very reproducible with an average standard deviation of 0.010 nmol/kg, resulting in a detection limit (3x this standard deviation) of 0.030 nmol/kg. Replicate analyses of the SAFe surface underway sample (not the official SAFe surface SRM but an in-house, large volume sample from the same cruise/site) averaged 0.079±0.050 nmol/kg (±1SD, n=73), which is within error of the consensus value of 0.090 nmol/kg. Replicate analyses of the SAFe D2 sample averaged 0.916±0.023 nmol/kg (±1SD, n=37, Bottle 446), which is within error of the consensus value of 0.90 nmol/kg.</p><p><strong>References:</strong><br /><strong>Cutter</strong>, G.A and Bruland, K.W. 2012. Rapid and noncontaminating sampling system for trace elements in global ocean surveys. Limnology &amp; Oceanography: Methods 10: 425-436. doi: <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.4319/lom.2012.10.425" target="_blank">10.4319/lom.2012.10.425</a><br /><strong>Bruland</strong>, K.W., Rue, E.L., Smith, G.J., and DiTullio, G.R. 2005. Iron, macronutrients and diatom blooms in the Peru upwelling regime: brown and blue waters of Peru. Marine Chemistry 93:81-103. doi: <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.marchem.2004.06.011" target="_blank">10.1016/j.marchem.2004.06.011</a><br /><strong>Fitzsimmons</strong>, J.N. and Boyle, E.A. 2012. An intercalibration between the GEOTRACES GO-FLO and the MITESS/Vanes sampling systems for dissolved iron concentration analyses (and a closer look at adsorption effects). Limnology &amp; Oceanography: Methods 10: 437-450.<br /><strong>Lee</strong>, J.-M., Boyle, E.A., Echegoyen-Sanz, Y., Fitzsimmons, J.N., Zhang, R., and Kayser, R.A. 2011. Analysis of trace metals (Cu, Cd, Pb, and Fe) in seawater using single batch nitrilotriacetate resin extraction and isotope dilution inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry. Analytica Chimica Acta 686: 93-101. doi: <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.aca.2010.11.052" target="_blank">10.1016/j.aca.2010.11.052</a></p>

gmd:credit.gmx:Anchor: Funding provided by NSF Ocean Sciences (NSF OCE) Award Number: OCE-0926197 Award URL: http://www.nsf.gov/awardsearch/showAward?AWD_ID=0926197&HistoricalAwards=false

gmd:deliveryPoint.gco:CharacterString: Chemical Oceanography, Trace Metal Group MIT E25-619, 45 Carleton St

gmd:keyword.gmx:Anchor: salinity calculated from CTD primary sensors

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: Access Constraints: none. Use Constraints: Please follow guidelines at: http://www.bco-dmo.org/terms-use Distribution liability: Under no circumstances shall BCO-DMO be liable for any direct, incidental, special, consequential, indirect, or punitive damages that result from the use of, or the inability to use, the materials in this data submission. If you are dissatisfied with any materials in this data submission your sole and exclusive remedy is to discontinue use.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: GEOTRACES is a SCOR sponsored program; and funding for program infrastructure development is provided by the U.S. National Science Foundation.GEOTRACES gained momentum following a special symposium, S02: Biogeochemical cycling of trace elements and isotopes in the ocean and applications to constrain contemporary marine processes (GEOSECS II), at a 2003 Goldschmidt meeting convened in Japan. The GEOSECS II acronym referred to the Geochemical Ocean Section Studies To determine full water column distributions of selected trace elements and isotopes, including their concentration, chemical speciation, and physical form, along a sufficient number of sections in each ocean basin to establish the principal relationships between these distributions and with more traditional hydrographic parameters;* To evaluate the sources, sinks, and internal cycling of these species and thereby characterize more completely the physical, chemical and biological processes regulating their distributions, and the sensitivity of these processes to global change; and* To understand the processes that control the concentrations of geochemical species used for proxies of the past environment, both in the water column and in the substrates that reflect the water column.GEOTRACES will be global in scope, consisting of ocean sections complemented by regional process studies. Sections and process studies will combine fieldwork, laboratory experiments and modelling. Beyond realizing the scientific objectives identified above, a natural outcome of this work will be to build a community of marine scientists who understand the processes regulating trace element cycles sufficiently well to exploit this knowledge reliably in future interdisciplinary studies.

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31886.rdf Name: expo_code Units: text Description: Expedition code. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31887.rdf Name: cruise_name Units: text Description: Official cruise identifier e.g. KN199-04 = R/V Knorr cruise number 199-04. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31888.rdf Name: station Units: integer Description: Station number; provided in original data submission. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31889.rdf Name: cast Units: integer Description: Cast number; provided in original data submission. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31890.rdf Name: event_GEOTRC Units: integer Description: Unique identifying number for US GEOTRACES sampling events; ranges from 2001 to 2225 for KN199-04 events and from 3001 to 3282 for KN204-01 events. PI-supplied values were identical to those in theintermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'GEOTRC_EVENTNO', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31891.rdf Name: sample_GEOTRC Units: integer Description: Unique identifying number for US GEOTRACES samples; ranges from 5033 to 6078 for KN199-04 and from 6112 to 8148 for KN204-01. PI-supplied values were identical to those in the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'GEOTRC_SAMPNO', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31892.rdf Name: sample Units: integer Description: Sample number; provided in original data submission. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31893.rdf Name: bottle_GEOTRC Units: unitless Description: Alphanumeric characters identifying bottle type (e.g., NIS representing Niskin and GF representing GOFLO) and position on a CTD rosette. PI-supplied values were identical to those in the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'BTLNBR', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31894.rdf Name: bot_flag Units: unitless Description: Bottle quality flag, following the WOCE protocol. See http://woce.nodc.noaa.gov/woce_v3/wocedata_1/whp/exchange/exchange_format_desc.htm. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31895.rdf Name: date Units: YYYYmmdd Description: Date (UTC). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31896.rdf Name: time Units: HHMM Description: Time (UTC). 24-hour clock. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31897.rdf Name: lat Units: decimal degrees Description: Latitude. South is negative. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31898.rdf Name: lon Units: decimal degrees Description: Longitude. West is negative. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31899.rdf Name: depth_w Units: meters Description: Depth of the water (bottom depth). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31900.rdf Name: press Units: decibars Description: Pressure (from CTD). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31901.rdf Name: depth Units: meters Description: Sample depth (from CTD); provided in original data submission. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31902.rdf Name: temp Units: degrees C Description: Temperature from CTD. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31903.rdf Name: sal_ctd Units: PSU Description: Salinity from CTD. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31904.rdf Name: sal_ctd_flag Units: unitless Description: Quality flag for sal_ctd. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31905.rdf Name: sal Units: PSU Description: Salinity measured using a salinometer. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31906.rdf Name: sal_flag Units: unitless Description: Quality flag for sal. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31907.rdf Name: Fe_sol Units: nmol/kg Description: Soluble iron (Fe). The Fe passing through a 0.02 um Anodisc membrane filter measured in nmol Fe per kilogram of seawater. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31908.rdf Name: Fe_sol_sd Units: nmol/kg Description: Standard deviation of replicates of Fe_sol. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31909.rdf Name: no_reps Units: integer Description: Number of replicates. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31910.rdf Name: Fe_sol_flag Units: unitless Description: Quality flag for Fe_sol. See 'Processing Description' for code definitions. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32129.rdf Name: cruise_id Units: text Description: Official cruise identifier. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32964.rdf Name: ISO_DateTime_UTC Units: YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS.ssZ Description: Date/Time (UTC) formatted to ISO8601 standard. T indicates start of time string; Z indicates UTC.Calculated from date and time fields contributed by PI. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33036.rdf Name: station_GEOTRC Units: dimensionless Description: GEOTRACES station number; ranges from 1 through 12 for KN199-04 and 1 through 24 for KN204-01. Stations 7 and 9 were skipped on KN204-01. Some GeoFish stations are denoted as X_to_Y indicating the tow occurred between stations X and Y. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33037.rdf Name: cast_GEOTRC Units: dimensionless Description: Cast identifier numbered consecutively within a station. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33038.rdf Name: sample_bottle_GEOTRC Units: dimensionless Description: Unique identification numbers given to samples taken from bottles; ranges from 1 to 24; often used synonymously with bottle number. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33039.rdf Name: depth_GEOTRC_CTD Units: meters Description: Observation/sample depth in meters; calculated from CTD pressure. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: GB/NERC/BODC > British Oceanographic Data Centre, Natural Environment Research Council, United Kingdom

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P02/current/ACYC/ Name: Reference numbers Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P02/current/ACYC/ Name: Reference numbers Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/ADATAA01/ Name: Date (UT as yyyymmdd) Description: Unavailable http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/AHMSAA01/ Name: Time (UT as hh24miss) Description: Time elapsed between 00:00 UT on the date of the event of interest and that event. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/LATX/ Name: LATITUDE Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/LONX/ Name: LONGITUDE Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/PRESPR01/ Name: Pressure (spatial co-ordinate) exerted by the water body by profiling pressure sensor and corrected to read zero at sea level Description: The force per unit area exerted by the water column on a mobile sensor located in the water column. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/DEPH/ Name: DEPTH BELOW SEA SURFACE Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/TEMPP901/ Name: Temperature (ITS-90) of the water body Description: The degree of hotness at any position within a volume of fresh or salt water expressed against the International Temperature Scale 1990 (ITS-90) calibration standard. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/PSALST01/ Name: Practical salinity of the water body by CTD and computation using UNESCO 1983 algorithm Description: This is the preferred term for this definition. Alternative term PSALST02 is included to cover cases where there are two sensors of the same type contributing to the data set and referential integrity considerations prevent a usage of a single code. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/PSALST01/ Name: Practical salinity of the water body by CTD and computation using UNESCO 1983 algorithm Description: This is the preferred term for this definition. Alternative term PSALST02 is included to cover cases where there are two sensors of the same type contributing to the data set and referential integrity considerations prevent a usage of a single code. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P03/current/C035/ Name: Metal and metalloid concentrations Description: Parameters pertaining to metal and trace metalloid (i.e. excluding Si) concentrations in any material. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/DTUT8601/ Name: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision) Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z' http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/DEPH/ Name: DEPTH BELOW SEA SURFACE Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface.

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Expedition code.; General Description: The cruise_name is a local name chosen by project investigators for a research expedition on a vessel, as opposed to the formal/official cruise ID asserted by the vessel operator.

PI-supplied Description: Official cruise identifier e.g. KN199-04 = R/V Knorr cruise number 199-04.; General Description: The cruise_name is a local name chosen by project investigators for a research expedition on a vessel, as opposed to the formal/official cruise ID asserted by the vessel operator.
PI-supplied Description: Station number; provided in original data submission.; General Description: consecutive station number
PI-supplied Description: Cast number; provided in original data submission.; General Description: cast or profile number

PI-supplied Description: Unique identifying number for US GEOTRACES sampling events; ranges from 2001 to 2225 for KN199-04 events and from 3001 to 3282 for KN204-01 events. PI-supplied values were identical to those in theintermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'GEOTRC_EVENTNO', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions.; General Description: event or operation number; often derived from date/time (MMDDHHmm) of sampling and when combined with year (YYYY) is a unique sampling identifier/data processing key. Date/time is not necessarily in GMT.

PI-supplied Description: Unique identifying number for US GEOTRACES samples; ranges from 5033 to 6078 for KN199-04 and from 6112 to 8148 for KN204-01. PI-supplied values were identical to those in the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'GEOTRC_SAMPNO', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions.; General Description: unique sample identification or number; any combination of alpha numeric characters; precise definition is file dependent NERC Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers

PI-supplied Description: Sample number; provided in original data submission.; General Description: unique sample identification or number; any combination of alpha numeric characters; precise definition is file dependent NERC Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers

PI-supplied Description: Alphanumeric characters identifying bottle type (e.g., NIS representing Niskin and GF representing GOFLO) and position on a CTD rosette. PI-supplied values were identical to those in the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'BTLNBR', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions.; General Description: rosette bottle number

PI-supplied Description: Bottle quality flag, following the WOCE protocol. See http://woce.nodc.noaa.gov/woce_v3/wocedata_1/whp/exchange/exchange_format_desc.htm.; General Description: quality flag; based on a PI established code; identifies a problem/quality issue with sample(s) from a given water bottle or single observation

PI-supplied Description: Date (UTC).; General Description: date; generally reported in GMT as YYYYMMDD (year; month; day); also as MMDD (month; day); EqPac dates are local Hawaii time NERC Description: Unavailable

PI-supplied Description: Time (UTC). 24-hour clock.; General Description: Time GMT defined as HHMM; time of day; generally reported in GMT as HHMM (hours and minutes) but may also be HH.H (decimal hours) or HHMMSS (hours; minutes and seconds); in EqPac time is reported as Hawaii local time NERC Description: Time elapsed between 00:00 UT on the date of the event of interest and that event.

PI-supplied Description: Latitude. South is negative.; General Description: latitude, in decimal degrees, North is positive, negative denotes South; Reported in some datasets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: Longitude. West is negative.; General Description: longitude, in decimal degrees, East is positive, negative denotes West; Reported in some datsets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest.
PI-supplied Description: Depth of the water (bottom depth).; General Description: water depth, in meters

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Pressure (spatial co-ordinate) exerted by the water body by profiling pressure sensor and corrected to read zero at sea level

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Pressure (from CTD).; General Description: water pressure at measurement; depth reported as pressure; positive number increasing with water depth NERC Description: The force per unit area exerted by the water column on a mobile sensor located in the water column.

PI-supplied Description: Sample depth (from CTD); provided in original data submission.; General Description: observation/sample depth, in meters; best estimate; usually but not always calculated from pressure; calculated either from CTD pressure using Fofonoff and Millard (1982; UNESCO Tech Paper #44) algorithm adjusted for 1980 equation of state for seawater (EOS80) or simply equivalent to nominal depth as recorded during sampling if CTD pressure was unavailable NERC Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface.

PI-supplied Description: Temperature from CTD.; General Description: water temperature at measurement depth NERC Description: The degree of hotness at any position within a volume of fresh or salt water expressed against the International Temperature Scale 1990 (ITS-90) calibration standard.

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Practical salinity of the water body by CTD and computation using UNESCO 1983 algorithm

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Salinity from CTD.; General Description: salinity from the CTD when water bottle tripped; calculated from conductivity per the PSS-78 scale NERC Description: This is the preferred term for this definition. Alternative term PSALST02 is included to cover cases where there are two sensors of the same type contributing to the data set and referential integrity considerations prevent a usage of a single code.

PI-supplied Description: Quality flag for sal_ctd.; General Description: quality flag; based on a PI established code; identifies a problem/quality issue with sample(s) from a given water bottle or single observation

gmd:sequenceIdentifier.xlink:title: salinity calculated from CTD primary sensors

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Practical salinity of the water body by CTD and computation using UNESCO 1983 algorithm

gco:aName.gco:CharacterString: salinity calculated from CTD primary sensors

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Salinity measured using a salinometer.; General Description: salinity, calculated from the CTD 'primary sensors' of conductivity and temperature, Practical Salinity Scale (PSS-78), dimensionless. Depending on the input source, salinity from the primary sensors can have a variety of names i.e. s0, s00, sal0, sal00. NERC Description: This is the preferred term for this definition. Alternative term PSALST02 is included to cover cases where there are two sensors of the same type contributing to the data set and referential integrity considerations prevent a usage of a single code.

PI-supplied Description: Quality flag for sal.; General Description: quality flag; based on a PI established code; identifies a problem/quality issue with sample(s) from a given water bottle or single observation

PI-supplied Description: Soluble iron (Fe). The Fe passing through a 0.02 um Anodisc membrane filter measured in nmol Fe per kilogram of seawater.; General Description: Concentration of a trace metal in seawater. Refer to dataset for element name and units. NERC Description: Parameters pertaining to metal and trace metalloid (i.e. excluding Si) concentrations in any material.

PI-supplied Description: Standard deviation of replicates of Fe_sol.; General Description: Standard deviation reported for the concentration of a trace metal in seawater. Refer to dataset for element and units.
PI-supplied Description: Number of replicates.; General Description: Number of replicate samples in an experimental procedure, test, or calculation.

PI-supplied Description: Quality flag for Fe_sol. See 'Processing Description' for code definitions.; General Description: quality flag; based on a PI established code; identifies a problem/quality issue with sample(s) from a given water bottle or single observation
PI-supplied Description: Official cruise identifier.; General Description: cruise designation; name

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision)

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Date/Time (UTC) formatted to ISO8601 standard. T indicates start of time string; Z indicates UTC.Calculated from date and time fields contributed by PI.; General Description: Date/Time (UTC) ISO formattedThis standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on any of the following forms:2009-08-30T09:05:00[.xx] (local time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]-05:00The dashes and the colons can be dropped.The T can also be dropped "by mutual agreement", but one needs the trailing Z if the time is UTC.Sample ISO_datetime_utc:2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)Format: YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS[.xx]Z (UTC time) NERC Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z'

PI-supplied Description: GEOTRACES station number; ranges from 1 through 12 for KN199-04 and 1 through 24 for KN204-01. Stations 7 and 9 were skipped on KN204-01. Some GeoFish stations are denoted as X_to_Y indicating the tow occurred between stations X and Y. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: consecutive station number

PI-supplied Description: Cast identifier numbered consecutively within a station. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: cast or profile number

PI-supplied Description: Unique identification numbers given to samples taken from bottles; ranges from 1 to 24; often used synonymously with bottle number. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: Niskin sample bottle number

PI-supplied Description: Observation/sample depth in meters; calculated from CTD pressure. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: observation/sample depth, in meters; best estimate; usually but not always calculated from pressure; calculated either from CTD pressure using Fofonoff and Millard (1982; UNESCO Tech Paper #44) algorithm adjusted for 1980 equation of state for seawater (EOS80) or simply equivalent to nominal depth as recorded during sampling if CTD pressure was unavailable NERC Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface.

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: <p>Trace metal-clean seawater samples were collected using the U.S. GEOTRACES sampling system consisting of 24 Teflon-coated GO-FLO bottles that had been pre-rinsed with a 24+ hour treatment of filtered surface seawater at the beginning of the cruise (see Cutter &amp; Bruland, 2012 for more information on the sampling system). At each station, the bottles were deployed open and tripped on ascent at 3 m/min. On deck, the bottles were kept in a trace metal clean sampling van over-pressurized with HEPA-filtered air, except immediately prior to and following deployments, in which cases they were covered on both ends with shower caps to avoid deck contamination.</p><p>During sampling in the clean van, the GO-FLO bottles were pressurized to ~0.4 atm with HEPA-filtered air, and their spigots were fitted with an acid-cleaned piece of Bev-a-Line tubing that fed into an Acropak-200 Supor capsule filter (0.2 µm pore size made of polyethersulfone). Before use, this filter had been filled with filtered surface seawater that had been acidifed to pH 2 with 4x Vycor-distilled hydrochloric acid ('trace metal clean HCl') and left overnight to rinse. Before collecting any subsamples, at least 500mL of seawater was passed through the filter (while eliminating air bubbles in the capsule reservoir). Subsamples were taken into acid-cleaned HDPE bottles after a single rinse. Acropak filters were used for at most 3 casts before a new filter was used, and they were stored empty in the refrigerator while not in use. GEOFish surface samples were taken using an all-plastic 'towed fish' pumping system as described in Bruland et al. 2005 at approximately 2 m depth and were subsampled identically.</p><p>Subsamples were immediately taken into a HEPA-filtered flow bench constructed in a 'plastic bubble' over-pressurized with HEPA-filtered air. They were then further filtered through an offline filter rig fitted with a 0.02 µm pore-sized alumina Anodisc filter (47mm) and pressurized to ~0.4atm. Un-rinsed filters were loaded straight into the filter rig and were first rinsed with &gt;50mL of pH 2 trace metal clean HCl, and then they were rinsed with &gt;50mL of Milli-Q water. Before each sample was processed, &gt;50mL of sample was passed through the filter. Subsamples were taken into acid cleaned HDPE bottles after a single bottle rinse. Filters were shared for at maximum 2 sampling depths to avoid filter clogging. All samples were filtered within 3-6 hours of being collected to avoid Fe loss to the bottle walls (Fitzsimmons &amp; Boyle, 2012), and samples were acidified at sea to pH 2 with trace metal clean HCl.</p><p>Samples were analyzed at least 5 months after acidification over 18 analytical sessions by the isotope-dilution ICP-MS methods described in Lee et al. 2011, which includes pre-concentration on nitrilotriacetate (NTA) resin and analysis on a Micromass IsoProbe MC-ICP-MS. On each day of sample analyses, procedure blanks were determined using 12 replicates of 300 µL of an in-house standard reference material seawater (SAFe surface underway), where the known amount of Fe in the 300 µL was subtracted out. The procedure blank over the relevant sessions ranged from 0.006-0.108 nmol/kg, averaging 0.051 nmol/kg. Procedure blanks were very reproducible with an average standard deviation of 0.010 nmol/kg, resulting in a detection limit (3x this standard deviation) of 0.030 nmol/kg. Replicate analyses of the SAFe surface underway sample (not the official SAFe surface SRM but an in-house, large volume sample from the same cruise/site) averaged 0.079±0.050 nmol/kg (±1SD, n=73), which is within error of the consensus value of 0.090 nmol/kg. Replicate analyses of the SAFe D2 sample averaged 0.916±0.023 nmol/kg (±1SD, n=37, Bottle 446), which is within error of the consensus value of 0.90 nmol/kg.</p><p><strong>References:</strong><br /><strong>Cutter</strong>, G.A and Bruland, K.W. 2012. Rapid and noncontaminating sampling system for trace elements in global ocean surveys. Limnology &amp; Oceanography: Methods 10: 425-436. doi: <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.4319/lom.2012.10.425" target="_blank">10.4319/lom.2012.10.425</a><br /><strong>Bruland</strong>, K.W., Rue, E.L., Smith, G.J., and DiTullio, G.R. 2005. Iron, macronutrients and diatom blooms in the Peru upwelling regime: brown and blue waters of Peru. Marine Chemistry 93:81-103. doi: <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.marchem.2004.06.011" target="_blank">10.1016/j.marchem.2004.06.011</a><br /><strong>Fitzsimmons</strong>, J.N. and Boyle, E.A. 2012. An intercalibration between the GEOTRACES GO-FLO and the MITESS/Vanes sampling systems for dissolved iron concentration analyses (and a closer look at adsorption effects). Limnology &amp; Oceanography: Methods 10: 437-450.<br /><strong>Lee</strong>, J.-M., Boyle, E.A., Echegoyen-Sanz, Y., Fitzsimmons, J.N., Zhang, R., and Kayser, R.A. 2011. Analysis of trace metals (Cu, Cd, Pb, and Fe) in seawater using single batch nitrilotriacetate resin extraction and isotope dilution inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry. Analytica Chimica Acta 686: 93-101. doi: <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.aca.2010.11.052" target="_blank">10.1016/j.aca.2010.11.052</a></p>

<p>Samples were analyzed in triplicate, and average values shown in this dataset were only accepted if reproduced over at least two replicates; otherwise, the data was re-analyzed until a reproducible value was reached.</p><p>The standard Ocean Data View flags were used. A descripton of all flags is available on line at <a href="https://www.bodc.ac.uk/data/codes_and_formats/odv_format/" target="_blank">https://www.bodc.ac.uk/data/codes_and_formats/odv_format/</a>. Flags used in this dataset are as follows:<br />1 = Good Value: Good quality data value that is not part of any identified malfunction and has been verified as consistent with real phenomena during the quality control process.<br />2 = Probably Good Value: Data value that is probably consistent with real phenomena but this is unconfirmed or data value forming part of a malfunction that is considered too small to affect the overall quality of the data object of which it is a part. (Used when only one replicate confirmed the reported value.)<br />3 = Probably Bad Value: Data value recognized as unusual during quality control that forms part of a feature that is probably inconsistent with real phenomena.<br />4 = Bad Value: An obviously erroneous data value.<br />6 = Value Below Detection Limit: The level of the measured phenomenon was too small to be quantified by the technique employed to measure it. The accompanying value is the detection limit for the technique or zero if that value is unknown.<br />9 = Missing Value: The data value is missing. Any accompanying value will be a magic number representing absent data. (All samples collected were analyzed. Any missing data was not collected.)</p><p>The bot_flag, temp, sal_ctd, sal_ctd_flag, sal, and sal_flag columns were added from the GT11 GT-C bottle dataset. Refer to the <a href="http://osprey.bco-dmo.org/dataset.cfm?id=14079&amp;flag=view">GT11 GT-C bottle dataset</a> for more information on these parameters.</p><p>BCO-DMO made the following changes:<br />- Parameter names were modified to conform with BCO-DMO naming conventions.<br />- Blank cells and values of '-999' were replaced with 'nd' to indicate 'no data'.<br />- Added ISO_DateTime_UTC from original date and time fields.<br />- 01 March 2013: joined to master GEOTRACES file for consistency with other GEOTRACES datasets. Note: removed BTL_ISO_DateTime_UTC because values were all 'nd'.</p><p><strong>Additional GEOTRACES Processing:</strong><br />After the data were submitted to the International Data Management Office, BODC, the office noticed that important identifying information was missing in many datasets. With the agreement of BODC and the US GEOTRACES lead PIs, BCO-DMO added standard US GEOTRACES information, such as the US GEOTRACES event number, to each submitted dataset lacking this information. To accomplish this, BCO-DMO compiled a 'master' dataset composed of the following parameters: station_GEOTRC, cast_GEOTRC (bottle and pump data only), event_GEOTRC, sample_GEOTRC, sample_bottle_GEOTRC (bottle data only), bottle_GEOTRC (bottle data only), depth_GEOTRC_CTD (bottle data only), depth_GEOTRC_CTD_rounded (bottle data only), BTL_ISO_DateTime_UTC (bottle data only), and GeoFish_id (GeoFish data only). This added information will facilitate subsequent analysis and inter comparison of the datasets.<br /><br />Bottle parameters in the master file were taken from the GT-C_Bottle_GT10, GT-C_Bottle_GT11, ODF_Bottle_GT10, and ODF_Bottle_GT11 datasets. Non-bottle parameters, including those from GeoFish tows, Aerosol sampling, and McLane Pumps, were taken from the Event_Log_GT10 and Event_Log_GT11 datasets. McLane pump cast numbers missing in event logs were taken from the Particulate Th-234 dataset submitted by Ken Buesseler.<br /><br />A standardized BCO-DMO method (called "join") was then used to merge the missing parameters to each US GEOTRACES dataset, most often by matching on sample_GEOTRC or on some unique combination of other parameters.<br /><br />If the master parameters were included in the original data file and the values did not differ from the master file, the original data columns were retained and the names of the parameters were changed from the PI-submitted names to the standardized master names. If there were differences between the PI-supplied parameter values and those in the master file, both columns were retained. If the original data submission included all of the master parameters, no additional columns were added, but parameter names were modified to match the naming conventions of the master file.<br /><br />See the dataset parameters documentation for a description of which parameters were supplied by the PI and which were added via the join method.</p>

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmi:description.gco:CharacterString: PI Supplied Instrument Name: GO-FLO Bottle PI Supplied Instrument Description:Trace metal-clean seawater samples were collected using the U.S. GEOTRACES sampling system consisting of 24 Teflon-coated GO-FLO bottles that had been pre-rinsed with a 24+ hour treatment of filtered surface seawater at the beginning of the cruise (see Cutter & Bruland, 2012). Instrument Name: GO-FLO Bottle Instrument Short Name:GO-FLO Instrument Description: GO-FLO bottle cast used to collect water samples for pigment, nutrient, plankton, etc. The GO-FLO sampling bottle is specially designed to avoid sample contamination at the surface, internal spring contamination, loss of sample on deck (internal seals), and exchange of water from different depths. Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L05/current/30/

PI Supplied Instrument Name: Inductively Coupled Plasma Mass Spectrometer PI Supplied Instrument Description:Samples were analyzed by the isotope-dilution ICP-MS methods described in Lee et al. 2011, which includes pre-concentration on nitrilotriacetate (NTA) resin and analysis on a Micromass IsoProbe MC-ICP-MS. Instrument Name: Inductively Coupled Plasma Mass Spectrometer Instrument Short Name:ICP Mass Spec Instrument Description: An ICP Mass Spec is an instrument that passes nebulized samples into an inductively-coupled gas plasma (8-10000 K) where they are atomized and ionized. Ions of specific mass-to-charge ratios are quantified in a quadrupole mass spectrometer. Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L05/current/LAB15/

PI Supplied Instrument Name: GeoFish PI Supplied Instrument Description:GEOFish surface samples were taken using an all-plastic 'towed fish' pumping system as described in Bruland et al. 2005. Instrument Name: GeoFish Towed near-Surface Sampler Instrument Short Name:GeoFish Instrument Description: The GeoFish towed sampler is a custom designed near surface (<2m) sampling system for the collection of trace metal clean seawater. It consists of a PVC encapsulated lead weighted torpedo and separate PVC depressor vane supporting the intake utilizing all PFA Teflon tubing connected to a deck mounted, air-driven, PFA Teflon dual-diaphragm pump which provides trace-metal clean seawater at up to 3.7L/min. The GeoFish is towed at up to 13kts off to the side of the vessel outside of the ship's wake to avoid possible contamination from the ship's hull. It was developed by Geoffrey Smith and Ken Bruland (University of California, Santa Cruz). Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L05/current/31/

gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: International Council for the Exploration of the Sea
